instructions.overview: QuickBooks driver provides access to QuickBooks Online and Desktop data through the QuickBooks API. It supports querying accounting entities like customers, vendors, items, transactions with accounting-specific relationships.

dataModel.hierarchy: Company → Entities → Transactions → Line Items. Core entities include customers, vendors, items, accounts, employees. Transactions include invoices, bills, payments, purchases.
dataModel.relationships: invoices relate to customers. bills relate to vendors. line items relate to items and accounts. payments relate to invoices or bills. estimates can be converted to invoices.

queryPatterns.timeFiltering: Use MetaData.CreateTime, MetaData.LastUpdatedTime, or TxnDate with ISO format. Example: WHERE MetaData.CreateTime >= '2024-01-01T00:00:00Z'.
commonQueries: SELECT * FROM customers WHERE Active = true
SELECT * FROM invoices WHERE TxnDate >= '2024-01-01' AND Balance > 0
SELECT * FROM items WHERE Active = true AND Type = 'Inventory'
bestPractices: Filter by Active = true for current records
Use appropriate date ranges with TxnDate or MetaData fields
Include account types for meaningful account queries
Use customer/vendor references for transaction queries
Be aware of QuickBooks API rate limits and sync token requirements

fieldConventions.userFields: CreatedBy, ModifiedBy may reference employees or users depending on context.
fieldConventions.dateFields: MetaData.CreateTime, MetaData.LastUpdatedTime use ISO format. TxnDate uses YYYY-MM-DD format.
fieldConventions.idFields: Id is the primary key (string). Foreign keys reference related entities (CustomerId, VendorId, ItemId).

limitations: QuickBooks API has specific rate limits and throttling
Some operations require sync tokens for data consistency
Complex multi-entity queries may require multiple API calls
Historical data access depends on QuickBooks version and subscription
Some fields are read-only and cannot be modified
troubleshooting: Rate limit exceeded: Implement proper throttling and retry logic
Authentication errors: Verify OAuth tokens and company ID
Sync token errors: Refresh tokens and handle concurrent access
Permission denied: Check QuickBooks user permissions and app scope
Data inconsistency: Use appropriate filters and handle deleted records
